title: How to change viewport background color?
content:
If letterboxing (anti-fingerprinting) is used or when a webpage is smaller than the window (such as in about:config), Firefox fills in the rest of the window using a dark gray. I want to make it completely black.

This is what I currently have in my userContent.css

```CSS @-moz-document url-prefix("about"), url-prefix("chrome"){ 

 body{ background-color: rgb(0 0 0) !important };  .sticky-container{ background-color: rgb(0 0 0) !important };  #toolbar{ background-color: rgb(0 0 0) !important };

}@-moz-document url-prefix("about"), url-prefix("chrome"){ 

 body{ background-color: rgb(0 0 0) !important };  .sticky-container{ background-color: rgb(0 0 0) !important };  #toolbar{ background-color: rgb(0 0 0) !important };

} ```
creator: beaver.hacker

title: Calendar addons not working anymore
content: Neither of the two addons that bring up my Google calendar work anymore. They each bring up some goofy Google "workplace". It says I can log into my calendar, but when I try, it says it's sending me an authorization request, even though the "don't ask again" button is checked. I never get an request on my phone, just a "ding" announcement. Arrrggghhh...
creator: fridaymanyfeathers

title: Gmail on Firefox looks really weird
content: My Gmail always looks really weird in Firefox. I've messed with display and contrast settings and nothing's really fixed it. There's just these weird rectangles overlaying each other in different shades of gray across my inbox and they're hard to look at. I'm not sure if anyone else has experienced this or how to fix this. I've attached a small screenshot with my emails crossed out for some semblance of privacy.
creator: kaiwalton24
